Merge pull request #70 from python-hyper/improve-builder

Allow for modification of certain components

commit.message:
Allow for modification of certain components

When using the URIBulider, it's plausible that one would want to use a
base URI and then modify components like the path and query string
without replacing them wholesale. Let's add two methods for that as well
as a convenience method to replace the `.finalize().unsplit()` dance.

This updates our docs to be a bit friendlier and adds release notes for
this change.

Closes #29

verification.payload:
tree 768f021832e9239a602c394bba265b6476a9622b
parent 3657ec42f9cf7db7f49cc2bd487d9a0e1caaa967

committer Ian Stapleton Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com> 1586530451 -0500

When using the URIBulider, it's plausible that one would want to use a

without replacing them wholesale. Let's add two methods for that as well
as a convenience method to replace the `.finalize().unsplit()` dance.

This updates our docs to be a bit friendlier and adds release notes for
this change.

Closes #29

Merge pull request #69 from python-hyper/use-black

Use black to format the codebase and fix docs

commit.message:
Use black to format the codebase and fix docs

Enforce that black requires no changes in Travis as well. Furthermore,
re-enable our docs building and validation on Travis by fixing our
doctests.

For some reason, using the `.. doctest::` directive and tracebacks in
Sphinx causes problems with pygments' pycon3 lexer and so we have to use
the less explicit doctest format in our plain-rST docs.

verification.payload:
tree c6f9583e2124f168b96c70a146676bc48c572c0c
parent 1ca99c9dfa193157d2393e43795ebda1d9c1a094
author Ian Stapleton Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com> 1586438267 -0500
committer Ian Stapleton Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com> 1586444424 -0500

Use black to format the codebase and fix docs

Enforce that black requires no changes in Travis as well. Furthermore,
re-enable our docs building and validation on Travis by fixing our
doctests.

For some reason, using the `.. doctest::` directive and tracebacks in
Sphinx causes problems with pygments' pycon3 lexer and so we have to use
the less explicit doctest format in our plain-rST docs.

Merge pull request #64 from python-hyper/wide-domain-bypass-check-test

Guard against wide-domain checks

commit.message:
Guard against wide-domain checks

Previously, we would parse the malicious URL example with an authority
of 'user:pass@xdavidhu.me\\test.corp.google.com:8080' but we would not
parse that into its components because it had invalid characters. So
accessing the `host` attribute would result in `None`. That said,
someone might still have used the `authority` attribute and been misled.
To avoid misuse by developers, let's parse this similarly to the fix in
the blog post.

See also:
- https://bugs.xdavidhu.me/google/2020/03/08/the-unexpected-google-wide-domain-check-bypass/

verification.payload:
tree ea0e201b6e439959f15d35f8139bc3f5addf2120
parent 9a87fd6be06e4d04600cbd4d134c6975b7c1d94b
author Ian Stapleton Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com> 1586264399 -0500
committer Ian Stapleton Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com> 1586264399 -0500

Guard against wide-domain checks

Previously, we would parse the malicious URL example with an authority
of 'user:pass@xdavidhu.me\\test.corp.google.com:8080' but we would not
parse that into its components because it had invalid characters. So
accessing the `host` attribute would result in `None`. That said,
someone might still have used the `authority` attribute and been misled.
To avoid misuse by developers, let's parse this similarly to the fix in
the blog post.

See also:
- https://bugs.xdavidhu.me/google/2020/03/08/the-unexpected-google-wide-domain-check-bypass/
